intro: Linaria bastensis, commonly known as the Bastard Toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the genus Linaria in the family Plantaginaceae, which includes various species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is characterized by its yellow or orange flowers that resemble those of the common toadflax. Linaria bastensis is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
